title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: W. Storer How to Orlando Brown, January 11, 1866
summary: How's letter expresses grave concern that most of the Federal troops are being mustered out of the Shenandoah Valley. He believes that it will be nearly impossible to sustain the Bureau's activities without military support because of the high level of local opposition.
keywords: Military Authority, Race Relations, Patriotism, Education, American Civil War
